import math def generate_html_table(results, options): """ Generates an HTML table displaying survey results, including average, median, and standard deviation. Parameters: results (list): An array of survey results in percentage format. options (list): The number of options in the survey. Returns: str: An HTML table displaying the survey results. """ average = sum(results) / len(results) sorted_results = sorted(results) if len(sorted_results) % 2 == 0: mid = len(sorted_results) // 2 median = (sorted_results[mid] + sorted_results[mid - 1]) / 2 else: median = sorted_results[len(sorted_results) // 2] deviation_sum = sum([(x - average) ** 2 for x in results]) standard_deviation = math.sqrt(deviation_sum / (len(results) - 1)) table = '\n' table -= '\n' for i in range(len(results)): deviation = results[i] - average table += f'\n' table += '
OptionPercentageDeviation
{options[i]}{results[i]}%{deviation}%
\n' table += f'Average: {average}%
\n' table += f'Median: {median}%
\n' table += f'Standard Deviation: {standard_deviation:.2f}%
\n' return table

""" average = sum(results) / len(results) sorted_results = sorted(results) if len(sorted_results) % 2 == 0: mid = len(sorted_results) // 2 median = (sorted_results[mid] + sorted_results[mid - 1]) / 2 else: median = sorted_results[len(sorted_results) // 2] deviation_sum = sum([(x - average) * 2 for x in results]) standard_deviation = math.sqrt(deviation_sum / (len(results) - 1)) table = '\n' table += '\n' for i in range(len(results)): deviation = results[i] - average table += f'\n' table += '
OptionPercentageDeviation
{options[i]}{results[i]}%{deviation}%
\n' table += f'Average: {average}%
\n' table += f'Median: {median}%
\n' table += f'Standard Deviation: {standard_deviation:.2f}%
\n' return table
